title: Excludes for-profit business or corporate entities from applying to establish a charter school
summary: Excludes for-profit business or corporate entities from applying to establish a charter school or from being approved to operate a charter school.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1880

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. McENENY, JACOBS, GLICK, CLARK -- Multi-Sponsored
         by -- M. of A.  ABBATE, CAHILL, GOTTFRIED, MARKEY, PRETLOW, WEISENBERG
         -- read once and referred to the Committee on Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to eligibility to  estab-
         lish a charter school

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section 2851  of  the  education  law,  as
    2  amended  by  chapter  101  of  the  laws  of 2010, is amended to read as
    3  follows:
    4    1. An application to establish a charter school may  be  submitted  by
    5  teachers,  parents,  school  administrators,  community residents or any
    6  combination thereof.  Such application may be filed in conjunction  with
    7  a  college, university, museum, educational institution, OR not-for-pro-
    8  fit corporation exempt from taxation under paragraph 3 of subsection (c)
    9  of section 501 of the internal revenue code [or for-profit  business  or
   10  corporate  entity  authorized to do business in New York state. Provided
   11  however, for-profit]. FOR-PROFIT business or  corporate  entities  shall
   12  not  be  eligible to submit an application to establish a charter school
   13  pursuant to subdivision nine-a of section twenty-eight hundred fifty-two
   14  of this article, or operate or manage a charter  school  for  a  charter
   15  issued  pursuant  to  subdivision nine-a of section twenty-eight hundred
   16  fifty-two of this article AND UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHALL  AN  APPLICA-
   17  TION  TO  ESTABLISH  A  CHARTER  SCHOOL OR APPROVAL TO OPERATE A CHARTER
   18  SCHOOL BE GRANTED TO A FOR-PROFIT BUSINESS OR CORPORATE  ENTITY  AUTHOR-
   19  IZED  TO DO BUSINESS IN THIS STATE.  [For charter schools established in
   20  conjunction with a for-profit business or corporate entity, the  charter
   21  shall specify the extent of the entity's participation in the management
   22  and operation of the school.]
   23    S  2.  This  act shall take effect immediately, and shall apply to all
   24  applications to establish a charter school pending or submitted prior to
   25  such effective date and still pending as well  as  to  all  applications
   26  submitted on or after the effective date of this act.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01793-01-1
